properties.description: This initiave extends the Azure Security Center default policy with addtional recommended security policies for governance.

policyDefinitions.policyDefinitionReferenceId: A maximum of 3 owners should be designated for your subscription_1
Activity log should be retained for at least one year_1
A vulnerability assessment solution should be enabled on your virtual machines_1
Adaptive application controls for defining safe applications should be enabled on your machines_1
Adaptive network hardening recommendations should be applied on internet facing virtual machines_1
Add system-assigned managed identity to enable Guest Configuration assignments on virtual machines w_1
Add system-assigned managed identity to enable Guest Configuration assignments on VMs with a user-as_1
Azure Defender for servers should be enabled_1
Advanced data security should be enabled on SQL Managed Instance_1
Advanced data security should be enabled on your SQL servers_1
[Preview]: All Internet traffic should be routed via your deployed Azure Firewall_1
All network ports should be restricted on network security groups associated to your virtual machine_1
An activity log alert should exist for specific Administrative operations_1
An activity log alert should exist for specific Policy operations_1
An activity log alert should exist for specific Security operations_1
An Azure Active Directory administrator should be provisioned for SQL servers_1
API App should only be accessible over HTTPS_1
API Management services should use a virtual network_1
App Configuration should use private link_1
Audit diagnostic setting_1
Audit Linux machines that allow remote connections from accounts without passwords_1
Audit Linux machines that allow remote connections from accounts without passwords_2
Audit Linux machines that do not have the passwd file permissions set to 0644_1
Audit usage of custom RBAC rules_1
Audit VMs that do not use managed disks_1
Audit Windows machines that allow re-use of the previous 24 passwords_1
Audit Windows machines that do not have a maximum password age of 70 days_1
Audit Windows machines that do not have a minimum password age of 1 day_1
Audit Windows machines that do not have the password complexity setting enabled_1
Audit Windows machines that do not restrict the minimum password length to 14 characters_1
Audit Windows machines that do not store passwords using reversible encryption_1
Auditing on SQL server should be enabled_1
Authentication should be enabled on your API app_1
Authentication should be enabled on your Function app_1
Authentication should be enabled on your web app_1
Authorized IP ranges should be defined on Kubernetes Services_1
Auto provisioning of the Log Analytics agent should be enabled on your subscription_1
Automation account variables should be encrypted_1
Azure Backup should be enabled for Virtual Machines_1
Azure Cache for Redis should reside within a virtual network_1
Azure Cosmos DB accounts should have firewall rules_1
Azure DDoS Protection Standard should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for App Service should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for Azure SQL Database servers should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for container registries should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for Key Vault should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for Kubernetes should be enabled_1
Azure Defender for Storage should be enabled_1
Azure Event Grid domains should use private link_1
Azure Event Grid topics should use private link_1
Azure Key Vault Managed HSM should have purge protection enabled_1
Azure Machine Learning workspaces should use private link_1
Azure Monitor log profile should collect logs for categories 'write,' 'delete,' and 'action'_1
Azure Monitor should collect activity logs from all regions_1
Azure Policy Add-on for Kubernetes service (AKS) should be installed and enabled on your clusters_1
Azure SignalR Service should use private link_1
Azure Spring Cloud should use network injection_1
Azure subscriptions should have a log profile for Activity Log_1
Cognitive Services accounts should disable public network access_1
Cognitive Services accounts should enable data encryption_1
Cognitive Services accounts should restrict network access_1
Cognitive Services accounts should use customer owned storage or enable data encryption._1
Connection throttling should be enabled for PostgreSQL database servers_1
Container registries should not allow unrestricted network access_1
Container registries should use private link_1
CORS should not allow every resource to access your API App_1
CORS should not allow every resource to access your Function Apps_1
CORS should not allow every resource to access your Web Applications_1
Custom subscription owner roles should not exist_1
Deploy the Linux Guest Configuration extension to enable Guest Configuration assignments on Linux VM_1
Deploy the Windows Guest Configuration extension to enable Guest Configuration assignments on Window_1
Deprecated accounts should be removed from your subscription_1
Deprecated accounts with owner permissions should be removed from your subscription_1
Diagnostic logs in App Services should be enabled_1
Disconnections should be logged for PostgreSQL database servers._1
Disk encryption should be applied on virtual machines_1
Email notification for high severity alerts should be enabled_1
Email notification to subscription owner for high severity alerts should be enabled_1
Endpoint protection solution should be installed on virtual machine scale sets_1
Enforce SSL connection should be enabled for PostgreSQL database servers_1
Enforce SSL connection should be enabled for MySQL database servers_1
Ensure API app has 'Client Certificates (Incoming client certificates)' set to 'On'_1
Ensure that 'HTTP Version' is the latest, if used to run the API app_1
Ensure that 'HTTP Version' is the latest, if used to run the Function app_1
Ensure that 'HTTP Version' is the latest, if used to run the Web app_1
Ensure that 'Java version' is the latest, if used as a part of the API app_1
Ensure that 'Java version' is the latest, if used as a part of the Function app_1
Ensure that 'Java version' is the latest, if used as a part of the Web app_1
Ensure that 'PHP version' is the latest, if used as a part of the API app_1
Ensure that 'PHP version' is the latest, if used as a part of the WEB app_1
Ensure that 'Python version' is the latest, if used as a part of the API app_1
Ensure that 'Python version' is the latest, if used as a part of the Function app_1
Ensure that 'Python version' is the latest, if used as a part of the Web app_1
Ensure WEB app has 'Client Certificates (Incoming client certificates)' set to 'On'_1
External accounts with owner permissions should be removed from your subscription_1
External accounts with read permissions should be removed from your subscription_1
External accounts with write permissions should be removed from your subscription_1
[Preview]: Firewall should be enabled on Key Vault_1
FTPS only should be required in your API App_1
FTPS only should be required in your Function App_1
FTPS should be required in your Web App_1
Function App should only be accessible over HTTPS_1
Function apps should have 'Client Certificates (Incoming client certificates)' enabled_1
Non-internet-facing virtual machines should be protected with network security groups_1
Internet-facing virtual machines should be protected with network security groups_1
IP Forwarding on your virtual machine should be disabled_1
[Preview]: Key Vault keys should have an expiration date_1
[Preview]: Key Vault secrets should have an expiration date_1
Key vaults should have purge protection enabled_1
Key vaults should have soft delete enabled_1
Kubernetes cluster containers should not share host process ID or host IPC namespace_1
Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed capabilities_1
Kubernetes cluster containers should only use allowed AppArmor profiles_1
Kubernetes cluster containers should run with a read only root file system_1
Kubernetes cluster pod hostPath volumes should only use allowed host paths_1
Kubernetes cluster pods and containers should only run with approved user and group IDs_1
Kubernetes cluster pods should only use approved host network and port range_1
Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers_1
Kubernetes cluster should not allow privileged containers_2
Kubernetes clusters should be accessible only over HTTPS_1
Kubernetes clusters should not allow container privilege escalation_1
Kubernetes Services should be upgraded to a non-vulnerable Kubernetes version_1
Latest TLS version should be used in your API App_1
Latest TLS version should be used in your Function App_1
Latest TLS version should be used in your Web App_1
Log Analytics agent health issues should be resolved on your machines_1
[Preview]: Log Analytics Agent should be enabled for listed virtual machine images_1
Log Analytics agent should be enabled in virtual machine scale sets for listed virtual machine image_1
[Preview]: Log Analytics agent should be installed on your Linux Azure Arc machines_1
Log Analytics agent should be installed on your virtual machine for Azure Security Center monitoring_1
Log Analytics agent should be installed on your virtual machine scale sets for Azure Security Center_1
[Preview]: Log Analytics agent should be installed on your Windows Azure Arc machines_1
Log checkpoints should be enabled for PostgreSQL database servers_1
Log connections should be enabled for PostgreSQL database servers_1
Managed identity should be used in your API App_1
Managed identity should be used in your Function App_1
Managed identity should be used in your Web App_1
Management ports of virtual machines should be protected with just-in-time network access control_1
Management ports should be closed on your virtual machines_1
MFA should be enabled accounts with write permissions on your subscription_1
MFA should be enabled on accounts with owner permissions on your subscription_1
MFA should be enabled on accounts with read permissions on your subscription_1
Monitor missing Endpoint Protection in Azure Security Center_1
[Preview]: Network traffic data collection agent should be installed on Linux virtual machines_1
[Preview]: Network traffic data collection agent should be installed on Windows virtual machines_1
Only secure connections to your Azure Cache for Redis should be enabled_1
Private endpoint connections on Azure SQL Database should be enabled_1
[Preview]: Private endpoint should be configured for Key Vault_1
Private endpoint should be enabled for MariaDB servers_1
Private endpoint should be enabled for MySQL servers_1
Private endpoint should be enabled for PostgreSQL servers_1
Public network access on Azure SQL Database should be disabled_1
Public network access should be disabled for MariaDB servers_1
Public network access should be disabled for MySQL servers_1
Public network access should be disabled for PostgreSQL servers_1
RDP access from the Internet should be blocked_1
Remote debugging should be turned off for API Apps_1
Remote debugging should be turned off for Function Apps_1
Remote debugging should be turned off for Web Applications_1
Resource logs in Azure Data Lake Store should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Azure Key Vault Managed HSM should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Batch accounts should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Data Lake Analytics should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Event Hub should be enabled_1
Resource logs in IoT Hub should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Key Vault should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Logic Apps should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Search services should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Service Bus should be enabled_1
Resource logs in Virtual Machine Scale Sets should be enabled_1
Role-Based Access Control (RBAC) should be used on Kubernetes Services_1
Secure transfer to storage accounts should be enabled_1
Security Center standard pricing tier should be selected_1
Service Fabric clusters should have the ClusterProtectionLevel property set to EncryptAndSign_1
Service Fabric clusters should only use Azure Active Directory for client authentication_1
Service principals should be used to protect your subscriptions instead of management certificates_1
SQL servers should retain audit data for at least 90 days_1
SSH access from the Internet should be blocked_1
[Preview]: Storage account public access should be disallowed_1
Storage accounts should allow access from trusted Microsoft services_1
Storage accounts should be migrated to new Azure Resource Manager resources_1
Storage accounts should restrict network access_1
Storage accounts should restrict network access using virtual network rules_1
Storage accounts should use private link_1
Subnets should be associated with a Network Security Group_1
Subscriptions should have a contact email address for security issues_1
System updates on virtual machine scale sets should be installed_1
System updates should be installed on your machines_1
There should be more than one owner assigned to your subscription_1
Transparent Data Encryption on SQL databases should be enabled_1
Unattached disks should be encrypted_1
Virtual machines should be migrated to new Azure Resource Manager resources_1
VM Image Builder templates should use private link_1
Vulnerabilities in Azure Container Registry images should be remediated_1
Vulnerabilities in container security configurations should be remediated_1
Vulnerabilities in security configuration on your machines should be remediated_1
Vulnerabilities in security configuration on your virtual machine scale sets should be remediated_1
Vulnerabilities in security configuration on your virtual machine scale sets should be remediated_2
Vulnerability assessment should be enabled on SQL Managed Instance_1
Vulnerability assessment should be enabled on your SQL servers_1
Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Application Gateway_1
Web Application Firewall (WAF) should be enabled for Azure Front Door Service service_1
Web Application should only be accessible over HTTPS_1
Windows web servers should be configured to use secure communication protocols_1
